repnme.cdata!: Argentina - Heads of Household Transition Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Heads of Household
            Transition Project for Argentina were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and the Borrower performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the heads of
            household program had been a successful crisis response, but
            it is important for emergency programs to have an explicit
            exit strategy once the emergency is over. Supported by the
            Ministry of Labor, a substantial number of municipalities in
            Argentina decided to establish public employment services.
            It is important to ensure that the specific interventions
            for which the Bank is providing assistance are framed within
            a broader policy dialogue that provides a consistent
            strategic context. In the absence of flexible delivery
            systems for adult education, it is difficult to scale-up
            services and attract students. Process evaluations can be an
            important monitoring tool. Initiatives to promote employment
            are likely to be more effective if combined with up-front counseling.

repnme.cdata!: Argentina - Heads of Household Transition Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Heads of Household Transition
            Project for Argentina aims to help: (1) reduce poverty by
            supporting the workfare component of the Heads o f Household
            Program, including continued improvements in Program
            management and governance; and (2) promote activities aimed
            at getting more Program beneficiaries into full-time
            employment, thereby enabling them to graduate from the
            Program. There are four Project components. Component A (the
            largest) would continue financing transfer payments to
            beneficiaries o f the Heads o f Household Program who comply
            with the requirement to participate in workfare or
            training/education activities. Support would also be given
            the Ministry of Labor to reorient these activities so that
            they contribute more to improving the employment prospects
            of beneficiaries. Component B provides grants for productive
            sub-projects proposed by small groups of Program
            participants. Component C covers activities related to the
            establishing and strengthening employment services in some
            municipalities and testing instruments to facilitate the
            labor market insertion of Program beneficiaries. Component D
            supports governance improvements in the Program, as well as
            Project management, and monitoring and evaluation.
